content.description: Great problem with a variety of sequential movements.  Start with a left hand side pull and a right hand pinch.  Top-out can be a bit hairy.  Classic problem.
content.location: Located in the center of the Perspective Boulder.

content.description: Short but a couple hard moves. Sit start, hands on the fangs. Move up and left to the large jugs. Top out.
content.location: On the same boulder as the other problems. Scramble up a short slab to the right to access this semi cave.

content.description: This long, overhanging arete is a unique feature for the hills. After Andrew Bellilse, Luke Kretschmar and I moved a boulder out of the way and did some brushing we opened this low start to Eternal Now. Sit start way back on a rail and make several tensiony moves out the roof. A redpoint crux awaits.
content.location: Begin as far back as possible and follow the arete the whole way.

content.description: Sit-start with hands on either side of the bottom of the boulder.  Move out and up the left arête.  Difficult move gaining the arête.  Fun problem.
content.location: Located on the left side of the Perspective Boulder.

content.description: An excellent line of pockets and edges right up the center with a deadpoint/dyno crux to a perfect jug at the top. Committing! Sit start the same as for 'Fleeting Moments', after a move or two make a nice flowing transition left across the seam then go directly up the face.
content.location: Center line on the downhill side of the boulder.

content.description: Large block that is partially suspended in air on one side.  Contains the potential for a number of problems; most will probably be difficult.  Decent landing and unique features make it worth a visit.
